annotations.prefix: CAZyme analysis
annotations.postfix: sequence reads were searched against a library of modules derived from all entries in the Carbohydrate-Active enZymes (CAZy) database (www.cazy.org using FASTY33 e-value<10−6).

annotations.prefix: Pyrosequencing of total community DNA
annotations.postfix: sequencing runs were performed on the 454 FLX pyrosequencer from total fecal community DNA.

annotations.prefix: A gene-by-sample matrix was generated based on BLASTX comparisons of each microbiome with our custom 44-genome database, in order to calculate an odds ratio based on the frequency of each gene in each twin versus the respective

We complemented this approach with taxon-based methods27, which disregard some of the information contained in the phylogenetic tree of the taxa in question, but have the advantage that specific taxa unique to, or shared among, groups of samples can be identified (e.g., those from
annotations.postfix: or obese individuals).

annotations.prefix: A gene by sample matrix was then screened to identify genes ‘commonly-enriched’ in either the obese or
annotations.postfix: gut microbiome (defined by an odds ratio greater than 2 or less than 0.5 when comparing the pooled obese twin microbiomes to the pooled lean twin microbiomes and when comparing each individual obese twin microbiome to the aggregate lean twin microbiome, or vice versa).

annotations.postfix: microbiomes and when comparing each individual obese twin microbiome to the aggregate lean twin microbiome, or vice versa).

annotations.prefix: A gene-by-sample matrix was generated based on BLASTX comparisons of each microbiome with our custom 44-genome database, in order to calculate an odds ratio based on the frequency of each gene in each
annotations.postfix: versus the respective co-twin.

annotations.prefix: To determine if the UniFrac distances were on average significantly different for pairs of samples (i.e. between
annotations.postfix: , between twins and their mother, or between unrelated individuals), we performed a t-test on the UniFrac distance matrix, and generated a p-value for the t-statistic by permutation of the rows and columns as in the Mantel test, regenerating the t-statistic for 1,000 random samples, and using the distribution to obtain an empirical p-value.

annotations.prefix: To determine if the UniFrac distances were on average significantly different for pairs of samples (i.e. between twin-pairs, between
annotations.postfix: and their mother, or between unrelated individuals), we performed a t-test on the UniFrac distance matrix, and generated a p-value for the t-statistic by permutation of the rows and columns as in the Mantel test, regenerating the t-statistic for 1,000 random samples, and using the distribution to obtain an empirical p-value.

annotations.prefix: DNA obtained from three separate 10 mg frozen aliquots of each
annotations.postfix: were pooled (≥200µg DNA) and used for pyrosequencing (see below).

annotations.prefix: METHODS Community DNA preparation
annotations.postfix: were frozen immediately after they were produced.

annotations.prefix: An aliquot (~500mg) of each sample was then suspended, while frozen, in a solution containing 500 µl of extraction buffer [200 mM Tris (pH 8.0), 200 mM NaCl, 20 mM EDTA], 210 µl of 20% SDS, 500 µl of a mixture of phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1, pH 7.9), and 500 µl of a
annotations.postfix: of 0.1 mm-diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products, Bartlesville, OK).

other.title: Gene

annotations.postfix: gene sequence-based surveys Complementary phylogenetic and taxon-based methods were used to compare 16S rRNA sequences among fecal communities.

annotations.prefix: Prior to both types of analyses, we grouped
annotations.postfix: gene sequences into Operational Taxonomic Units (OTUs/phylotypes) using both cd-hit28 and the furthest-neighbor-like (FNL) algorithm, with a sequence identity threshold of 97%, which is commonly used to define ‘species’-level phylotypes.

annotations.prefix: Selection of operational taxonomic units (OTUs)
annotations.postfix: gene-derived pyrosequencing data were pre-processed to remove sequences with low quality scores, sequences with ambiguous characters, or sequences outside of the length bounds (V6 < 50nt, V2 < 200nt), and binned according to sample-specific barcode (e.g. ref.

annotations.prefix: PD is the total amount of branch length in a phylogenetic tree constructed from the combined
annotations.postfix: datasets, leading to the sequences in a given sample.

annotations.prefix: Tree building and UniFrac clustering for PCA analysis A relaxed neighbor-joining tree was built from one representative sequence per OTU using Clearcut31, employing the Kimura correction (the PH Lane mask was applied to
annotations.postfix: and full-length data), but otherwise with default comparisons.

annotations.prefix: Rarefaction and phylogenetic diversity (PD) measurements To determine which individuals had the most diverse communities of
annotations.postfix: bacteria, rarefaction plots and Phylogenetic Diversity (PD) measurements, as described by Faith32, were made for each sample.

annotations.prefix: Microbiome sequences were compared against the custom database of 44
annotations.postfix: genomes (BLASTX e-value<10−5, bitscore>50, and %identity>50).
